results.title: The Working parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Combining work with parenthood provides numerous pressures for working parents. P.G.R. looks at some of these problems, including house duties, mother’s re-entry to the workforce, workplace issues affecting women’s rights, managing chores while caring for children, and becoming a house husband. We talk to a number of people from a variety of backgrounds who have managed to balance the competing needs of their careers and their children.

results.title: The Work of the World Health Organisation
results.creator_credit: Janine Hamel-Minne, World Health Organisation and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Traces the history of the World Health Organisation from early attempts to develop an international program for prevention of epidemics to the current promotion of health. Also gives an overall view of the work and activities of the Organisation.

results.title: The Work of the kidneys. - 2nd. ed
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Frank V Robinson and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Examines the importance of the kidneys as regulators of the body’s internal environment. Shows the functions of the kidney’s major parts and the relationships of these parts to each other as well as describing the physiological mechanisms by which the kidneys control the volume and composition of body fluids.

results.title: The Work of the kidneys
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
The film opens with an analogy between the kidneys and the selective processes by which they eliminate waste from the body, and the machines which select various devices. Laboratory experiments show the properties of semi-permeable membranes which function in the kidneys and allow wastes to pass but restrict the passage of food materials. Content analysis charts demonstrate the difference between glomerular fluid and urine. Factors affecting the rate of urine formation, such as blood sugar content and external factors are also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films

results.title: The Work of the atmosphere
results.brief_description: In this film the following phenomena are studied: the effect of mechanical and chemical actions of the atmosphere on the earth”s surface; the areas affected by dust storms; examples of spalling, exfoliation, sandblasting, dunes, loess, banks and volcanic dust.

results.title: The Work of running water
results.brief_description: Water is the most effective agent of erosion. Its action is analysed. The formation of alluvial fans, meanders, potholes, waterfalls, cliffs, ledges, pillars, dikes, arroyos, desert and, and the upwards movements of the earth’s surface are studied in relation to running water. Models and scenes from all parts of the world show how running water wears away the land.

results.title: The Work of rivers
results.brief_description: Various forms of erosion, young and old river valleys, deltas, oxbow lakes, meanders, rejuvenated rivers, water gaps, alluvial fans, sandbars, the water cycle in nature, and flood control work, are studied in this film.
